content.description:
Dirty route located at the end of the fire wall. 

  Contains a harder start to easier climbing.  

  Could climb better if it got traffic and a good cleaning.
content.location: Last route at the fire wall (L-R)

content.description:
A good warm up for the fire wall. Climb through a perpetually wet dihedral and stem across the two faces until you start climbing the face on some precarious holds. 

  Some choss has left the route, with a bit more to go.  

  Other than the rock quality, it serves as a great moderate for the wall.
content.location: Just to the left of "Smoke Signal"

content.description: Hard face climbing on perfect Rock Creek stone. This one tests your vertical ninja skills on small crimps and polished feet before relaxing into the last few bolts of Fire Hazard next door.The first ascent was done climbing straight up past the third bolt through the mini edges and was estimated to be 12d/13a, but different beta was found that takes the climber out left at the crux and knocks the grade all the way down to lower-end 5.12. Once you've done the easier variation, try the path of most resistance for the extra points.
content.location: Furthest left line on the fire wall at the moment, just left of Fire Hazard. Shares the last bolt and anchors with Fire Hazard.

content.description: Shares the same tricky start and first bolt of Burn In Hell. Clip the 2nd bolt just right of the jug then prepare for the crux. Move quickly past the bolts angling up and to the right through fun powerful sequences of crimpy face climbing and strenuous clips before you flame out. Pull another tricky sequence up the slightly bulging left facing corner, then fire up the roof on jugs to the anchor.
content.location: Shared start with Burn in Hell. Look for the chalked jugs under the low roof about 30' before you get to the oddly shaped tree growing under the cliffline.

content.description:
Tricky Dihedral climbing! 

  Stick clip the first bolt, then fire up a small initial boulder problem that will lead you into a good resting stance to assess the dihedral above. 

  From here tech your way up the awesome corner using an array of skills.  

  Once you reach the break beneath the roof, compose yourself and keep it together for the tricky, yet simple roof pull.

 Fantastic route that will give a seasoned climber a run for their money at the grade.
content.location: First route as you walk into the fire wall.

content.description: A few semi- powerful bouldery sequences with cool holds followed by easy jug bashing to the top.
content.location: Route right of "Burned at the Stake"

content.description:
Thuggy moves right off the gate, lead to a kneebar rest and an in your face crux right after.  

  Don't let up, as a few more bouldery moves await you until the climb begins to un-steepen. 

  Amazing quality of moves on this line!
content.location: In the middle of the Fire wall, to the left of "Burnt To Ash"

content.description: High 1st bolt stick-clip in the roof. Start with big moves on suspect rock to gain the first break and then bust out your Trad skils and handjam and ring lock out a 60degree overhang to a thin powerful crux separated by a ghost kneebar. Exit the steep climbing off the "ghost kneebar" with an awesome V4-5 compression sequence. Roll over the lip at the roof and climb 10+/11- to the anchors. Open Project bolted by Kyle Rowden. Someone send this rig.
content.location: Left most route of the Firewall Cave. There is a small spring at the base of this steep route and the belay can be muddy.Â

content.description: Boulder through the start of "The Extinguisher" but trend left following a long under clinging flake. The redpoint crux awaits at the end of the flake.
content.location: Same start as "The Extuinguisher" but trends left.

content.description: starts to the right of Extinguisher links into the same finish. A series of long moves (and or jumps) with good rests in between. Classic Rock Creek compression crux
content.location: right of Extinguisher, same finish. start to the left of a large car sized boulder on the ground. trends left

content.description:
A Bouldery start leads into some more bouldery moves which eventually eases up about halfway through the route.  

  Cop a rest at the ledge near the top of the climb and pull a 5.10/11 move right beneath the chains.
content.location: To the right of the Fire Wall. Just to the right of "Burnt to Ash"

content.description: Best 12a at Rock Creek with cryptic low knee bar crux to some dihedral climbing and upper mini-crux.

If you've run out of things to do or just can't seem to keep it together to send Burnt to Ash try linking up the bottom dyno boulder problem of BTA into Burned at the Stake. Stick clip the 1st bolt of BTA, climb the first crux and then traverse right a move or two on a good ledge and make a reachy 2nd clip on the 1st draw of BATS. It's helpful to have this draw pre-hung. Then send BATS. Really good power-endurance route and if you thought that crux of BATS was hard try doing it after the intro of BTA!
content.location: Start same as Burnt to Ash.

content.description:
A steep wall with a good collection of routes with hard climbing. 

  Generally stays shaded most of the day and will stay dry during a rain.
